author: Special Correspondent
text:
Rail traffic was affected for a while on Tuesday night due to signalling problem near Sengulam railway station close to Tirunelveli– Nagercoil National Highway.

Key stolen

When the gatekeeper posted at Ilaiyamuthur manned level crossing near Sengulam railway station went to have his dinner in a nearby hotel, some motorcycle-borne miscreants took away the key in the gate.

Since the key was stolen, a metal device could not be inserted in the signal switch to give signals to the oncoming Kanyakumari– Rameswaram and Chennai– Guruvayoor Express trains.

The gatekeeper immediately informed the Station Master of Sengulam railway station of the problem. The Station Master, in turn, took up the issue with his higher-ups in Nagercoil.

Substitute key

A substitute key was rushed to Ilaiyamuthur level crossing, and the problem was sorted out after a delay of more than an hour.
title: Signalling problem hits rail traffic
